description.narrative: Project aims at BRDN to become a legally formalized entity contributing to sustainable socio-economic development of rural areas in the Western Balkan Region; To provide organisational capacity building to BRDN’s member networks by exchange of good practices. Increased participation of women in BRDN’s structures and improved advocacy work of rural women within the Western Balkan Region. Expected results are - BRDN structure formalized as accountable organisation for continuous empowering of rural stakeholders in the Western Balkan; - Increased participation of rural women in BRDN’s structures and in the rural community’s decision-making processes for achieving enhanced outreach and advocacy work in the Western Balkan Region; - Improved operational performance and managerial capacities of BRDN and its ability to implement strategic long-term organisational plan, thus increasing its effectiveness, and its accountability to members and beneficiaries; - Improved institutional capacities of BRDN’s member networks (based on the capacity assessment of the members networks); - Improved organisational performance and managerial capacities of RDN of RM; - Increased capacities of BRDN’s member networks for implementation of LEADER approach; - Increased capacities of the existing and potential Local Action Groups as nucleus for local rural economic development through the LEADER approach.

" • Rural Development Network Macedonia (RDN of RM) as implementing partner undertook actions to support BRDN in becoming a legally formalized entity contributing to sustainable socio-economic development of rural areas in the Western Balkan Region. Draft versions of the BRDN procedures for the management and executive bodies of BRDN and the draft version of the BRDN statute has been prepared. The documents will be finalized at the participatory workshop planned to be organised in Skopje during the first half of December 2018. • ""Woman Hub of BRDN"" was formed within the frame of the project. All members of the BRDN nominated their representatives in the Women Hub and the first workshop of the Women Hub resulted in identification of some of the main priorities that need to be included in the BRDN strategy: Mainstreaming of Gender Equality within BRDN as cross-cutting strategic priority that should be achieved through the following sub-priorities: o Development of the capacities of Women Hub; o Promotion, communication and visibility; o Advocacy and lobbying for Gender Equality in sustainable Rural Development. • Training Needs Assessment (TNA) for the BRDN members' networks was conducted, based on a well structured questionnaire. The findings of the Training Needs Assessment will be used to develop Organisational Development Action Plan for the national networks, members of BRDN. • The annual assembly of RDN of RM, with attendance of 31 representatives of 27 members organisations, was an opportunity to identify the main strategic priorities of RDN of RM in the forthcoming period and to develop a draft Action Plan for the development of the new strategy. "

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity

description.narrative: " • Rural Development Network Macedonia (RDN of RM) as implementing partner undertook actions to support BRDN in becoming a legally formalized entity contributing to sustainable socio-economic development of rural areas in the Western Balkan Region. All members of the BRDN nominated their representatives in the Women Hub and the first workshop of the Women Hub resulted in identification of some of the main priorities that need to be included in the BRDN strategy: Mainstreaming of Gender Equality within BRDN as cross-cutting strategic priority that should be achieved through the following sub-priorities: o Development of the capacities of Women Hub; o Promotion, communication and visibility; o Advocacy and lobbying for Gender Equality in sustainable Rural Development. • Training Needs Assessment (TNA) for the BRDN members' networks was conducted, based on a well structured questionnaire. The findings of the Training Needs Assessment will be used to develop Organisational Development Action Plan for the national networks, members of BRDN. • The annual assembly of RDN of RM, with attendance of 31 representatives of 27 members organisations, was an opportunity to identify the main strategic priorities of RDN of RM in the forthcoming period and to develop a draft Action Plan for the development of the new strategy. "
